aws::graph::propositions: # Meteorological Information and Flight Plan for Accident
Conditions at the accident site were Visual Meteorological Conditions (VMC).
The condition of light at the accident site was day.
The observation facility was OSA.
OSA is at an elevation of 364 feet mean sea level.
The observation facility was 10 nautical miles from the accident site.
The observation time was 08:55 local time.
The observation facility was 225 degrees from the accident site.
The lowest cloud condition was clear.
Visibility at the accident site was 10 miles.
There was no ceiling at the accident site.
No wind speed or gusts were reported.
No actual turbulence was reported.
No wind direction was reported.
Turbulence severity actual was not applicable.
The altimeter setting was 30.14 inches of mercury.
The temperature was 11 degrees Celsius.
The dew point was 11 degrees Celsius.
There was no obscuration at the accident site.
There was no precipitation at the accident site.
The departure point was Winnsboro, Texas.
No flight plan was filed.
The destination was Omaha, Texas.
No clearance was obtained for the flight.
The departure time was 07:00 local time.
The type of airspace was unknown.

text:
# Meteorological Information and Flight Plan

Conditions at Accident Site: Visual (VMC)

Observation Facility, Elevation: OSA,364 ft msl
Distance from Accident Site: 10 Nautical Miles
